intro: Lastrea cyclochlamys, commonly known as the cyclochlamys hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and can grow up to 20 centimeters in length. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth.
